metadata.title: CVE-2015-8804 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
x86_64/ecc-384-modp.asm in Nettle before 3.2 does not properly handle carrypropagation and produces incorrect output in its implementation of theP-384 NIST elliptic curve, which allows attackers to have unspecifiedimpact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8804` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhogweed4 - 3.2-1
libnettle6 - 3.2-1
nettle-bin - 3.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nettle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2-1').
